net.rcode.nanomaps
Class MapLayer

java.lang.Object
  ViewGroup
      net.rcode.nanomaps.MapLayer
All Implemented Interfaces:
MapConstants, MapStateAware
public class MapLayer
extends ViewGroup
implements MapStateAware, MapConstants

MapLayers are direct parents of a MapSurface and are responsible for managing the layout and display of children that are either responsible for managing their own geographic context or have LayoutParams indicating their position.

Each MapLayer occupies the entire area of its parent.

The MapLayer is a ViewGroup but overrides much ViewGroup behavior, specifically relating to child drawing. Since the MapLayer will consist of many children that are not immediately visible, it opimizes child drawing pretty heavily. As a result, there is a lot of default behavior that comes with a ViewGroup that may not work out of the box on a MapLayer (ie. Animation, scroll offsets, etc).

Author:
stella

mapStateUpdated

public void mapStateUpdated(MapState mapState,
                            boolean full)
Description copied from interface: MapStateAware
Called when the mapstate has changed. If full is false, then it can be assumed that this update is purely related to the origin is changing. Otherwise, assume that the full geometry has changed.

Specified by:
mapStateUpdated in interface MapStateAware

refreshChildLayout

public void refreshChildLayout(View child)
It is perfectly legal to call child.setLayoutParams to update current position and/or bias, this invokes the full View layout processing on the MapLayer which is expensive and unnecessary. In addition to traversing and measuring/positioning all children, it triggers a full screen invalidate. As an alternative, update the fields on LayoutParams directly and call this method with your child to do the minimum work.

Parameters:
child -
